shortDescription: Thanks to our agent planted inside the Directorate, we have gained access to the entrance to the Citadel, Tyrlon's planetary fortress, but we need you to fight your way inside and defeat my cousin Victoria, who is personally leading my uncle's forces on the planet. Without House Parata's forces they have no reinforcements available, but neither will you until my Royal Guard secures the Prime Minister from the Directorate's guards.
longDescription: Lady Victoria will be a fearsome foe, Commander.

dialogueContent.words: [static] It took you long enough, Kamea… I'm all ready for you.[static]
Those gates on either side need to be taken down before entering the Citadel.
Blow them down and make your way inside... or jump the walls, if your lance is capable of it. Your call.
Excellent work, Commander—the Citadel is ours.
[static] What's this?! Mercenaries? Dear cousin, you disappoint me again [static]
Lady Victoria's lance is moving out of their Mech Bays, watch out!
Sit tight, Commander—Lady Arano is aware of the situation. Reinforcements are on the way.
Engines prepped and ready, Commander. I'll set her down as soon as you're finished with those hostiles.
There are two entrances into the Citadel, Commander. Intel says that each is defended by a series of elevated turrets.
I'm also seeing an LRM emplacement between the two checkpoints.
We know there's at least a lance patrolling outside, plus Lady Victoria's command lance.
Clear away the opposition and capture the Citadel. Lady Arano will push harder to join us once we make our move.
The Citadel is ours! And Lady Victoria appears to be down.
The Royal Guards will secure her fallen BattleMech and recover my cousin's body. Afterwards, her 'Mech is yours, Commander.
Kamea, Colonel Haust has arranged for the surrender of all remaining Directorate forces on Tyrlon.
It is over then. The Sword of the Restoration has won.
Lady Arano, your mercenaries failed miserably on their task.
